oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Gov. Isham Harris refusing H. C. Lockhart's resignation from Tennessee General Assembly
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This document was one of a quartet of framed documents. It is a note from Gov. Isham Harris on January 2, 1862 referring to the resignation of H.C. Lockhart of Stewart Couny from the Tennessee General Assembly in which Harris refuses to accept the resignation. Lockhart was a Lt. Col. In the 50th Regiment, Tennessee Infantry, Confederate and was a prisoner of war at Fort Warren, Mass.
